original: 'chad par 'gyur ba mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rang zhin nyid kyis rab tu phyi ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid do /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rang zhin nyid kyis rab tu phyi ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid do /
translated: She is the essence of the perfection of wisdom, which is fully endowed with the nature of the eight realizations that will be explained.

original: gang zhig kun shes ni shes pas srid la mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i don gyi dngos po dgu yongs su shes pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gang zhig kun shes ni shes pas srid la mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i don gyi dngos po dgu yongs su shes pa'i rang bzhin te /

original: zhi ba tshol ba rnams grol bar byed pa'i don gyis nyan thos kyi sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas kyang zhi ba'i nye bar mthun pas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis thob par byed do //
analyzed: zhi ba tshol ba rnams grol bar byed pa'i don gyis nyan thos kyi sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas kyang zhi ba'i nye bar mthun pas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis thob par byed do //
translated: She is the one who causes the hearers and solitary realizers to attain the two types of nirvana, because they are similar to peace, since they are liberated by seeking peace.

original: gang zhig lam shes pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid sngon du song ba'i bdag nyid mog mog por byed la sogs pa 'chad dpar 'gyur ba'i dngos po bcu gcig gi bdag nyid yongs su shes pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gang zhig lam shes pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid sngon du song ba'i bdag nyid mog mog por byed la sogs pa 'chad dpar 'gyur ba'i dngos po bcu gcig gi bdag nyid yongs su shes pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The path knowledge is the nature of complete knowledge of the eleven topics that will be explained, such as the creation of darkness and so on, which is preceded by the knowledge of all aspects and of the knowledge of the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba 'gro ba rnams la phan par byed pa'i don gang zhig de yis rdzogs par byed pa'o //üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang thob pa thams cad shes pa dang / lam shes pa nyid sngon du song ba can ni rnam pa kun @190a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba 'gro ba rnams la phan par byed pa'i don gang zhig de yis rdzogs par byed pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang thob pa thams cad shes pa dang / lam shes pa nyid sngon du song ba can ni rnam pa kun @190a * //
translated: The activity of the bodhisattvas is the benefit of beings, and that is accomplished by that knowledge.

original: mkhyen pas rab tu phye ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: mkhyen pas rab tu phye ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of the path that is preceded by the knowledge of all aspects, which is the nature that is distinguished by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sna tshogs rnam pa 'di dag kun gsungs pa zhes ston pa'i mtshan nyid bya ba'i sgo nas rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs rnam pa 'di dag kun gsungs pa zhes ston pa'i mtshan nyid bya ba'i sgo nas rtogs par bya ste /
translated: It is to be understood by the characteristic of the teacher, the statement of all these various aspects.

original: sems bskyed pa ni zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dngos po bcu yongs su shes par 'gyur pa'i bdag nyid dang ldan zhes pa ni gang zhig dngos su mdzad pa'i sna tshogs rnam pa 'di dag kun shes pa la rnam pa kun ni chos thams
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dngos po bcu yongs su shes par 'gyur pa'i bdag nyid dang ldan zhes pa ni gang zhig dngos su mdzad pa'i sna tshogs rnam pa 'di dag kun shes pa la rnam pa kun ni chos thams
translated: The line ‚Äúthe generation of the mind‚Äù and so on refers to the ten topics that will be explained. The line ‚Äúendowed with the nature of complete knowledge‚Äù refers to the one who actually performs all these various aspects. The line ‚Äúall aspects‚Äù refers to all phenomena.üîΩ

original: cad do // 'di dag ni 'di rnams so thub pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: cad do // 'di dag ni 'di rnams so thub pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The generation of the mind is the ten topics to be explained beginning with the one who is endowed with the nature of complete knowledge of... The one who is endowed is the one who actually performs the various aspects. All aspects are all phenomena. These are these. Sage is the Lord Buddha.

original: gsungs zhes pa ni gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gsungs zhes pa ni gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: The teaching is the teaching itself.

original: de zhes pa ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i slob ma'i tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes pa ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i slob ma'i tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who is endowed is the one who is endowed with the assembly of disciples, the Hearers and Bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yum ni skyon dang yon tan thams cad gtong ba dang thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid skyed byed ma ste phyag 'tshal bstod ces bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yum ni skyon dang yon tan thams cad gtong ba dang thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid skyed byed ma ste phyag 'tshal bstod ces bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The Mother of the Buddhas is the perfection of wisdom itself, the producer, by the cause of abandoning all faults and attaining all virtues. Homage and praise is connected.

original: 'di skad ces 'bras bu mngon par rtogs par byed bas mngon par rtogs pa ste rgyur gyur pa bdun no //
analyzed: 'di skad ces 'bras bu mngon par rtogs par byed bas mngon par rtogs pa ste rgyur gyur pa bdun no //
translated: Thus, there are seven factors that are causes, and one factor that is a result.

original: mngon par rtogs par bya bas mngon par rtogs pa ste 'bras bar gyur pa gcig po ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par bya bas mngon par rtogs pa ste 'bras bar gyur pa gcig po ste /
translated: The result is the clear realization, because it is what is clearly realized.

original: de ltar mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom has the nature of eight clear realizations.

original: 'dir kun shes zhes pa la sogs pa'i gsum po nyid rab tu dbye bas ci ste phyag 'tshal zhes brjod par ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir kun shes zhes pa la sogs pa'i gsum po nyid rab tu dbye bas ci ste phyag 'tshal zhes brjod par ni mi bya ste /
translated: Here, one should not say that one should pay homage to the three alone, such as the one who knows all, by way of their division.

original: 'di rnams nyid ni dngos po'i rab tu dbye bas phye ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid ni dngos po'i rab tu dbye bas phye ba yin la /
translated: These three are distinguished by the division of things.

original: gzhan kun ni 'di rnams las spros pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan kun ni 'di rnams las spros pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The others are elaborations from these three.

original: de lta bas na gsum po 'di rnams nyid 'dus pa ni mngon par rtogs pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsum po 'di rnams nyid 'dus pa ni mngon par rtogs pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: Thus, the collection of these three is the fourth clear realization.

original: rab tu gsal bar song ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar song ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The one that has become very clear is the fifth.

original: go rims su rtogs pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: go rims su rtogs pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: The one that is realized in sequence is the sixth.

original: gnas skabs kyi dbye bas gnas kyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa rtogs pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbye bas gnas kyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa rtogs pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the realization of the characteristic of the abode, which is the division into stages.

original: 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i bya ba dang bcas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum gyi bdag nyid ni brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i bya ba dang bcas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum gyi bdag nyid ni brgyad pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the body of the Tathagata, which has the three natures and the activity of working for the welfare of living beings.

original: de lta bas na gsum po 'di rnams nyid ni dngos po'i rab tu dbye bas phye ba zhes rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i ched du gsum po 'di rnams nyid kyis rab tu dbye bas phyag 'tshal zhes ba ni skyon med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsum po 'di rnams nyid ni dngos po'i rab tu dbye bas phye ba zhes rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i ched du gsum po 'di rnams nyid kyis rab tu dbye bas phyag 'tshal zhes ba ni skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not a fault to say that the homage is made by means of these three, in order to make known that these three are the divisions of the classification of entities.

original: gzhan dag 'di snyam du ma mthong ba dang / ma thos @190b pa dang ; sngar rnam par ma shes pa'i yul rnams la ji ltar blos mi dpyod pa de bzhin du mthong ba dang thos pa dang / sngar rnam par shes pa'i yul rnams kyang dpyod pa med pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'di snyam du ma mthong ba dang / ma thos @190b pa dang ; sngar rnam par ma shes pa'i yul rnams la ji ltar blos mi dpyod pa de bzhin du mthong ba dang thos pa dang / sngar rnam par shes pa'i yul rnams kyang dpyod pa med pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Others think that just as the mind does not investigate objects that are not seen, not heard, and not previously cognized, so also it does not investigate objects that are seen, heard, and previously cognized, and it has a nature free from investigation.

original: chos thams chad ni rab tu mi gnas pa zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: chos thams chad ni rab tu mi gnas pa zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: All phenomena are said to be nonabiding.

original: byed pa med pa'am /
analyzed: byed pa med pa'am /
translated: It is without action.üîΩIt is the state that is utterly beyond all conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'am /
translated: It is the state of the inconceivable yoga.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin med cing kun rdzob tu phung po lnga po'i rgyun rnams grub po zhes pa'am /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin med cing kun rdzob tu phung po lnga po'i rgyun rnams grub po zhes pa'am /
translated: It is the state in which all phenomena are ultimately without inherent existence and conventionally the continuity of the five aggregates is established.

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i ye shes zhes pa'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i ye shes zhes pa'am /
translated: It is the state of the wisdom of the unborn nature of all phenomena.

original: gzung ba'am 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba nam mkha' lta bur snang ba med par gsal ba'i rgyun no zhes pa'am /
analyzed: gzung ba'am 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba nam mkha' lta bur snang ba med par gsal ba'i rgyun no zhes pa'am /
translated: It is the state of the continuity of the clarity of the absence of appearances, which is like space and is free from the duality of subject and object.

original: nam mkha' thams cad du khyad cing sna tshogs kyi mtshan ma nub pa ltar spros pa mtha' dag ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du gsal bas rgyun no zhes pa'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' thams cad du khyad cing sna tshogs kyi mtshan ma nub pa ltar spros pa mtha' dag ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du gsal bas rgyun no zhes pa'am /
translated: It is the state of the continuity of the clarity of the nature of great bliss, in which all conceptual elaborations are pacified, like the disappearance of all the various characteristics of space.

original: sprul pa'i skyes bu ltar ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i mthus longs spyod dang gnas la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni gsal ba'i rgyun tsam mo zhes pa'am //üîΩsems can so so la thog ma dang tha ma med par ji srid so sor snang ba de srid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa las nges par grol ba dgag par mi nus pa'i gsal ba tsam lus dang longs spyod dang gnas la sogs pa'i sna
analyzed: sprul pa'i skyes bu ltar ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i mthus longs spyod dang gnas la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni gsal ba'i rgyun tsam mo zhes pa'am // sems can so so la thog ma dang tha ma med par ji srid so sor snang ba de srid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa las nges par grol ba dgag par mi nus pa'i gsal ba tsam lus dang longs spyod dang gnas la sogs pa'i sna
translated: The appearance of the various aspects of enjoyments, abodes, and so on is merely a continuum of clarity, like the appearance of a magical being that is delightful if not examined.

original: tshogs pa'i rnam pa'i 'khor lo'i bdag nyid du gsal ba'i rgyun no zhes pa'am /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i rnam pa'i 'khor lo'i bdag nyid du gsal ba'i rgyun no zhes pa'am /
translated: Or, the continuum of clarity is the wheel of the various aspects of bodies, enjoyments, abodes, and so on, which is the mere clarity that cannot be refuted, free from the limitations of apprehended object and apprehending subject, cause and effect, and so on, appearing to each sentient being from beginningless time until the end of the three realms.

original: sems can rnams la ji srid so sor snang ba de srid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtha' bzhi las nges par grol ba gsal ba tsam dgag par mi nus pa gnyis su med pa'i sems su gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: sems can rnams la ji srid so sor snang ba de srid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtha' bzhi las nges par grol ba gsal ba tsam dgag par mi nus pa gnyis su med pa'i sems su gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: Or, the continuum of clarity is the nondual mind, which is the mere clarity that cannot be refuted, free from the limitations of apprehended object and apprehending subject, cause and effect, and the four extremes, appearing to each sentient being from beginningless time until the end of the three realms.

original: pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshig gi don nyen bar mang du brjod de /
analyzed: pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshig gi don nyen bar mang du brjod de /
translated: The meaning of the words of the perfection of wisdom is extensively expressed.

original: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te de bzhin gshegs pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te de bzhin gshegs pa'o /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is nondual wisdom, the Tathagata.

original: bsgrub bya de'i don du sbyor bas gzhung dang lam dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ma yin nam /üîΩde la 'dir mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi dag nyid kyi shes @191a * //
analyzed: bsgrub bya de'i don du sbyor bas gzhung dang lam dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ma yin nam / de la 'dir mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi dag nyid kyi shes @191a * //
translated: Is it not said that the treatise and the path are also for the sake of that to be accomplished, by the application of that?

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ci ste bshad ces sems pa la bden te /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ci ste bshad ces sems pa la bden te /
translated: Here, the purity of the eight realizations is the perfection of wisdom. What is this taught to be?

original: so so rang rang gi bsam pas don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di lta bu nyid de /
analyzed: so so rang rang gi bsam pas don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di lta bu nyid de /
translated: It is true that the ultimate perfection of wisdom is just this, according to one's own understanding.

original: bcas pa'i bcas pa gsum gyi sgra'i brjod bya rnams 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden par bsdus pa zhes nye bar brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcas pa'i bcas pa gsum gyi sgra'i brjod bya rnams 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden par bsdus pa zhes nye bar brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: It is said that the expressed objects of the three kinds of injunctions are included in the cessation and the truth of the path.

original: de yongs su bstan par bya ba yang 'og nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshig gi don bshad pa'i skabs su 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de yongs su bstan par bya ba yang 'og nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshig gi don bshad pa'i skabs su 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The teaching of that will occur below in the section explaining the meaning of the words of the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang ji srid du rab tu phye ba dkar po'i chos rnams yang dag par bsdus pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i theg pa gsum gyi sgra'i brjod bya rnams 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden par bsdus pa gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: yang ji srid du rab tu phye ba dkar po'i chos rnams yang dag par bsdus pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i theg pa gsum gyi sgra'i brjod bya rnams 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden par bsdus pa gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: Moreover, the subject matter expressed by the words of the three vehicles, which is the nature of the perfect inclusion of the phenomena of the pure distinctions, together with their results, is included in the truth of the path and cessation.üîΩFor the sake of easily understanding that perfection of wisdom, the eight realizations were composed by the Victor Maitreya.

original: de bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du mngon par rtogs pa brgyad so so'i rnam par dbye ba rgyal ba byams pas brtsams zhes pas kyang snga phyi 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du mngon par rtogs pa brgyad so so'i rnam par dbye ba rgyal ba byams pas brtsams zhes pas kyang snga phyi 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction between the earlier and later [texts].

original: tshigs bcad dang po'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs bcad dang po'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the first verse.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rgyas 'bring rnam pa gsum gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rim pa gsungs na /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rgyas 'bring rnam pa gsum gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rim pa gsungs na /
translated: Well, if the Lord himself has taught the perfection of wisdom in three versions, extensive, middle length, and brief, and in the sequence of the eight realizations,üîΩwhat is the purpose of composing this treatise?

original: de la bstan bcos 'di brtsams pa dgos pa ci yod ces zhus pa la gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de la bstan bcos 'di brtsams pa dgos pa ci yod ces zhus pa la gsungs pa ;
translated: The answer is:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
translated: The path to omniscience in all aspects

original: ston pas 'di las bshad pa gang //
analyzed: ston pas 'di las bshad pa gang //
translated: is taught in this text by the Teacher.

original: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin te //
translated: It is not experienced by others

original: blo dang ldan pas rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: but is realized by the wise.

original: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid kyi //
translated: The meaning of the sutras, which is the ten activities of the Dharma,

original: mdo don dran pa la bzhag nas //
analyzed: mdo don dran pa la bzhag nas //
translated: is set forth in the memory of the meaning

original: bde blag tu ni rtogs 'gyur ba //üîΩrtsom pa yi ni dgos pa yin ;
analyzed: bde blag tu ni rtogs 'gyur ba // rtsom pa yi ni dgos pa yin ;
translated: and is easily understood.

original: / zhes ba ste /

analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa dkar po'i chos thams cad bskyed cing 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa la sogs pa dang mthun par 'gyur ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the generation of the Thought, together with the will, etc., is like the earth, etc., in that it is the basis for all the virtuous natures, such as generating and holding all the natures, etc.

original: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa 'dun pa chung ngu dang bcas pa'i sems bskyed pa ni sa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa 'dun pa chung ngu dang bcas pa'i sems bskyed pa ni sa lta bu ste /
translated: Thus, the generation of the Thought, together with the small will, is like the earth,

original: dkar po'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi byed cing 'dzin par gyur pas so //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi byed cing 'dzin par gyur pas so //
translated: because it is the basis and the holder of the seeds of all the virtuous natures.

original: 'dun pa 'bring dang / @194b bcas pa ni gser lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa 'bring dang / @194b bcas pa ni gser lta bu ste /
translated: The generation of the Thought, together with the medium will, is like gold,

original: nam byang chub kyi bar du mi 'gyur zhing mi zad pas na'o //
analyzed: nam byang chub kyi bar du mi 'gyur zhing mi zad pas na'o //
translated: because it does not change and does not waste away until enlightenment.

original: 'dun pa chen po dang bcas pa ni zla ba tshes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa chen po dang bcas pa ni zla ba tshes pa lta bu ste /
translated: The generation of the Thought, together with the great will, is like the new moon,üîΩbecause it is the basis for the increase of the virtuous natures.

original: nyi ma so so la 'phel bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: nyi ma so so la 'phel bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it increases day by day.

original: sa dang po la 'jug pa'i lam dang bcas pas me lta bu ste /
analyzed: sa dang po la 'jug pa'i lam dang bcas pas me lta bu ste /
translated: It is like fire, together with the path of entry into the first stage,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum la sgrib pa'i shing bsregs pas na'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum la sgrib pa'i shing bsregs pas na'o //
translated: because it burns the wood of the obscurations to the three knowledges.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pa gter la bu ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pa gter la bu ste /
translated: It is like a treasure, together with the perfection of generosity,

original: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it satisfies all beings.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas rin chen 'byung gnas lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas rin chen 'byung gnas lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a mine of jewels, together with the perfection of morality,

original: yon tan mtha' dag gi rin chen 'byung ba'i rten du gyur pas so //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' dag gi rin chen 'byung ba'i rten du gyur pas so //
translated: because it is the basis for the jewels of all virtues.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas rgya mtsho chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas rgya mtsho chen po lta bu ste /
translated: It is like the great ocean, together with the perfection of patience,

original: mi mthun pa'i gnod pa thams cad kyis mi bskyed pas so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i gnod pa thams cad kyis mi bskyed pas so //
translated: because it is not agitated by any opposing conditions.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a diamond, together with the perfection of effort,

original: yid ches pa'i 'dod pa'i don gzhan gyis mi phyed pas na'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i 'dod pa'i don gzhan gyis mi phyed pas na'o //
translated: because it cannot be split by any desire for the objects of enjoyment.üîΩIt is like the king of mountains, together with the perfection of concentration,üîΩbecause it is not shaken by any distractions.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas ri bo lhun po lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas ri bo lhun po lta bu ste /
translated: It is like Mount Meru because it is endowed with the perfection of meditation,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i dmigs pa las rab tu mi g-yo bas so //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i dmigs pa las rab tu mi g-yo bas so //
translated: for it does not waver from the meditative object.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas sman lta bu ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas sman lta bu ste /
translated: It is like medicine because it is endowed with the perfection of wisdom,

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad rnams rab tu zhi bar byed pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad rnams rab tu zhi bar byed pas so //
translated: for it cures the diseases of the addictive and objective obscurations.

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a spiritual friend because it is endowed with the perfection of means,

original: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for it never abandons the welfare of sentient beings in any situation.

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu ste /
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a wish-fulfilling gem because it is endowed with the perfection of aspiration,

original: ji ltar smon lam btab pa bzhin 'bras bu thob pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar smon lam btab pa bzhin 'bras bu thob pas so //
translated: for it obtains the fruit in accordance with the aspiration.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas nyi ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas nyi ma lta bu ste /
translated: It is like the sun because it is endowed with the perfection of strength,

original: gdul bya'i sa bon rnams yongs su smin par byed pas so //
analyzed: gdul bya'i sa bon rnams yongs su smin par byed pas so //
translated: for it ripens the seeds of those to be trained.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas snyan pa'i glu'i sgra lta bu ste /üîΩgdul bya rnams 'jug par byed pa'i chos ston pas na'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bcas pas snyan pa'i glu'i sgra lta bu ste / gdul bya rnams 'jug par byed pa'i chos ston pas na'o //
translated: It is like a song of sweet sounds, because it is accompanied by the perfection of intuitive wisdom.

original: mngon par shes pa dang bcas par gyur pas rgyal po chen po lta bu ste /üîΩthogs pa med par sems can gyi don nyams su len pas so //üîΩbsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang bcas pas mdzod lta bu ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang bcas par gyur pas rgyal po chen po lta bu ste / thogs pa med par sems can gyi don nyams su len pas so // bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang bcas pas mdzod lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a great king, because it is accompanied by the superknowledges.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs du ma'i @195a * //üîΩgnas su gyur pas na'o //üîΩbyang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang bcas pas lam po che lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs du ma'i @195a * // gnas su gyur pas na'o // byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang bcas pas lam po che lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a treasury, because it is accompanied by the stores of merit and intuition.

original: 'phags pa thams cad gshegs pa dang rjes su gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad gshegs pa dang rjes su gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a highway, because it is accompanied by the factors of enlightenment.

original: thugs rje dang shes rab tu bcas pas bzhon pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: thugs rje dang shes rab tu bcas pas bzhon pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a vehicle, because it is accompanied by compassion and intuition.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar mi ltung zhing mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par bde bar yang dag par bzhud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar mi ltung zhing mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par bde bar yang dag par bzhud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a happy and correct departure, because it does not fall into the extremes of cyclic life and of nirvana, and because it does not dwell in nirvana.

original: gzungs dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang bcas pas bkod ma'i chu bo lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzungs dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang bcas pas bkod ma'i chu bo lta bu ste /
translated: It is like the river Ganges, because it is endowed with retention and the correct knowledges.

original: zad pa med par thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos thams cad 'dzin pas na'o //
analyzed: zad pa med par thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos thams cad 'dzin pas na'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible, because it retains all the teachings, those heard and those not heard.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa dang bcas pas sgra snyan lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa dang bcas pas sgra snyan lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a sweet sounding voice, because it is endowed with the gift of the Dharma.

original: thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la thar pa'i rgyu dang bcas par snyan par sgrog par byed pas so //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la thar pa'i rgyu dang bcas par snyan par sgrog par byed pas so //
translated: It speaks sweetly to disciples who desire liberation, because it is endowed with the cause of liberation.

original: theg pa gcig gi lam dang bcas pas chu bo'i rgyun lta bu ste /
analyzed: theg pa gcig gi lam dang bcas pas chu bo'i rgyun lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a flowing river, because it is endowed with the path of the single vehicle.

original: dbye ba med par gzhan gyi don byed pas na'o //
analyzed: dbye ba med par gzhan gyi don byed pas na'o //
translated: It performs benefit for others without distinction.

original: chos kyi sku dang bcas pas sprin lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang bcas pas sprin lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a cloud, because it is endowed with the Dharma body.

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs par sems can gyi don yang dag par mthong nas bdud rtsi'i char rab tu 'bebs pas so //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs par sems can gyi don yang dag par mthong nas bdud rtsi'i char rab tu 'bebs pas so //
translated: and in the Tusita heaven, etc., he sees the welfare of beings, and he rains down the rain of nectar.

original: de la las dang po pa'i sas yang dag par bsdus pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la las dang po pa'i sas yang dag par bsdus pa gsum mo //
translated: Here, the three that are included in the stage of the beginner are:

original: sa dang po la rab tu 'jug pa'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa gcig go ;
analyzed: sa dang po la rab tu 'jug pa'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa gcig go ;
translated: the one that is included in the path of entry to the first stage,

original: / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcus yang dag par bsdus ba mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi sa bcu'o //
analyzed: / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcus yang dag par bsdus ba mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi sa bcu'o //
translated: and the ten that are included in the ten stages, such as the Joyous, which are the stages of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: khyad par gyi lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa lnga'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa lnga'o //
translated: The five that are included in the special path are:

original: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi rab tu dbye bas sangs rgyas kyi sas yang dag par bsdus pa gsum te ;
analyzed: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi rab tu dbye bas sangs rgyas kyi sas yang dag par bsdus pa gsum te ;
translated: and the three that are included in the stage of Buddhahood, which are distinguished by the preparation, the actual accomplishment, and the conclusion.

original: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: The generation of the thought is of twenty-two kinds.

original: sems bskyed pa gsungs nas /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gsungs nas /
translated: Having explained the generation of the thought,

original: gdams ngag brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag brjod par bya ste /
translated: he should explain the precepts.

original: cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen las bya ba rnams slob pa ni gdams ngag ste /
analyzed: cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen las bya ba rnams slob pa ni gdams ngag ste /
translated: Having generated the Thought of Enlightenment in accordance with the rite, the instruction is the learning of the activities from the spiritual master.

original: de yang yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa bcur gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa bcur gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, it is said to be of ten kinds, by way of the objects:üîΩThe instruction is to be known as having ten aspects:

original: sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
analyzed: sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
translated: the practice, the Truths,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
translated: the Three Jewels, Buddha, etc.,üîΩnon-attachment, non-weariness,üîΩthe taking up of the path,

original: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
analyzed: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
translated: the five eyes, the superknowledges,üîΩthe six qualities, the path of insight,

original: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya ba la gdams ngag ni //üîΩbcu @195b yi bdag nyid shes par bya //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya ba la gdams ngag ni // bcu @195b yi bdag nyid shes par bya // zhes pa la /
translated: and the path of meditation.üîΩThe practice is the practice of the six perfections, as the Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: sgrub dang zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sgrub dang zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: What is the practice of the Bodhisattva?

original: ji srid sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du dkar po'i chos mtha' dag la yang dag par brten te thun mong ba la bslab par bya ba dang / bye brag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung bar bshad pa rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: ji srid sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du dkar po'i chos mtha' dag la yang dag par brten te thun mong ba la bslab par bya ba dang / bye brag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung bar bshad pa rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: Until the attainment of Buddhahood, one should practice the common path, which is to rely on all the virtuous dharmas.

original: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi rang bzhin dang bzhi la sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi rang bzhin dang bzhi la sgrub pa ste /
translated: In particular, one should practice the four kinds of practice: the armor-like practice, the practice of engagement, the practice of gathering, and the practice of definite emergence, which will be explained below.

original: gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni sgrub pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni sgrub pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: The instruction in practice is the realization of the characteristics of practice as they have been taught.

original: bden pa rnams shes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: bden pa rnams shes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams te /
translated: The knowledge of the truths is the four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
translated: They are the truth of suffering, the truth of origination, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path.

original: sdug bsngal ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ste /
translated: Suffering is the aggregates of form and so forth, which are the results.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is completely included in the world of sentient beings, which are the results.

original: kun 'byung ni de dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po de rnams nyid de /
analyzed: kun 'byung ni de dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po de rnams nyid de /
translated: The origin is the same as that, the aggregates of form, etc. which are the cause of the production of suffering.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i sems can gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i sems can gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in the sentient beings who are the cause.

original: 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal zad pa mya ngan las 'das pa ma skyes pa mi 'gag pa bya ba med pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i mi mthun par gyur pa 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu bcom pa phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyur
analyzed: 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal zad pa mya ngan las 'das pa ma skyes pa mi 'gag pa bya ba med pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i mi mthun par gyur pa 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu bcom pa phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyur
translated: Cessation is the extinction of suffering, nirvana, which is non-arisen, non-ceasing, non-active, the opposite of karma, afflictions, and birth, the complete destruction of all fears, the cause of all excellence,

original: gyur pa yod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid du grub pa zhes brjod pa'i dngos po'i bye brag ni mya ngan las 'das par 'dod do //
analyzed: gyur pa yod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid du grub pa zhes brjod pa'i dngos po'i bye brag ni mya ngan las 'das par 'dod do //
translated: and the characteristic of being free from all existence. This particular entity is called ‚Äúestablished‚Äù and is accepted as nirvana.

original: lam ni 'gog pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: lam ni 'gog pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The path is the cause of cessation.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni lam gyi bden pa zhes pa ste bye brag tu smra pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni lam gyi bden pa zhes pa ste bye brag tu smra pa'o //
translated: The eightfold noble path, which has the nature of morality, meditative stabilization, and wisdom, such as right view, is called the truth of path.

original: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po'i chos thams cad kyi sgra'i brjod bya 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pas kun tu brtags pa'i tshul de rnams thams cad ni byang chub sems dpas don dam par rang bzhin
analyzed: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po'i chos thams cad kyi sgra'i brjod bya 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pas kun tu brtags pa'i tshul de rnams thams cad ni byang chub sems dpas don dam par rang bzhin
translated: The Vaibhasikas and so on imagine that all phenomena, which have the nature of apprehendeds and apprehenders, are the expressed objects of terms, and they imagine that all of these are the four noble truths.

original: med cing kun rdzob tu thams cad snang bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: med cing kun rdzob tu thams cad snang bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas should understand that ultimately they are essenceless and that conventionally they all appear.

original: 'khor ba pa dang / slob pa @196a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa dang / slob pa @196a * //
translated: The term samsara refers to the three realms.

original: dang ; nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gal te de las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gcig yod na yang zhes pa'i phyogs 'di yang kun tu brtags pa'i tshul gyis 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin med cing kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: dang ; nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gal te de las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gcig yod na yang zhes pa'i phyogs 'di yang kun tu brtags pa'i tshul gyis 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin med cing kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: and the listeners, solitary realizers, bodhisattvas, perfect buddhas, and nirvƒÅ·πáa, and if there were even a single phenomenon that was superior to those, that position should also be understood to be devoid of intrinsic existence and to be posited conventionally, in the manner of an imputation.

original: chos de dag thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par de dang de'i rnam par gsal bar yongs su gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs su gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par de dang de'i rnam par gsal bar yongs su gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs su gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because all those phenomena are devoid of apprehended and apprehender and are simply the continuum of the transformation of one‚Äôs state.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i 'khor ba'i gnas skabs 'bras bur gyur pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i 'khor ba'i gnas skabs 'bras bur gyur pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the continuum of consciousness that is the resultant state of sa·πÉsƒÅra, which is accompanied by the afflictions, is the truth of suffering.

original: de nyid yongs su gyur pa de dang 'dra ba 'jig rten pha rol gyi rgyur gyur pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //

analyzed: gsum po gcig gi ngo bor gcig / ces pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object is the three in the nature of one.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa zhes ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa zhes ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect is nonconceptual meditative stabilization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams phan tshun rang bzhin gcig pa zhes pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams phan tshun rang bzhin gcig pa zhes pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object is the mutual sameness of the natures of the bodhisattva, meditative stabilization, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de yang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa de la rnam par rtog par mi byed ces pa ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de yang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa de la rnam par rtog par mi byed ces pa ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect is that bodhisattva not conceptualizing those meditative stabilizations and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad las shin tu 'dus pa'i chos kyi mchog ste rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad las shin tu 'dus pa'i chos kyi mchog ste rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The supreme mundane quality is the three aspects that are completely free from all mundane phenomena.

original: de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po rnams so sor chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gnyis su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po rnams so sor chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gnyis su shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus the factors conducive to penetrative insight should be understood as twelve, differentiated by small, medium, and great.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba nyid kyis spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi spong ba'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba brjod pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba nyid kyis spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi spong ba'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba brjod pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to express the correct application that abandons the four conceptual thoughts that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation, which are discordant classes, he says:

original: gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The conceptual thought of the apprehended is twofold,

original: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
analyzed: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
translated: By way of the basis and its antidote.

original: rmongs dang phung sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: rmongs dang phung sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: By way of the divisions of delusion, aggregates, and so forth,

original: de ni so sor rnam pa dgu //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: de ni so sor rnam pa dgu // zhes pa la /
translated: It is individually ninefold.

original: gzung ba'i rnam rtog de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam rtog de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The conceptual thought of the apprehended is twofold:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po la brten pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po la brten pa'o //
translated: That which is based on the class of affliction and that which is based on the class of antidote.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po de yang rnam pa dgu yin pa nyid kyis de'i rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po de yang rnam pa dgu yin pa nyid kyis de'i rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Since the class of affliction is ninefold, the conceptual thought of that is also ninefold.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po yang rnam pa dgu yin pa nyid kyis de'i rnam rtog kyang rnam pa dgu zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po yang rnam pa dgu yin pa nyid kyis de'i rnam rtog kyang rnam pa dgu zhes pa ste /
translated: Since the class of antidote is also ninefold, the conceptual thought of that is also ninefold.

original: gzung ba'i rnam rtog ni so sor rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam rtog ni so sor rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The discriminations of the apprehended are ninefold.

original: de la mi rig pas yongs su bslang ba'i yul nyid kyis na ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi rig pas yongs su bslang ba'i yul nyid kyis na ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Among them, the discrimination of non-knowledge is due to the object itself, which is aroused by non-knowledge.

original: phung po'i rnam par rtog pa dang ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang mtha' gnyis la zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnam @201b par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: phung po'i rnam par rtog pa dang ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang mtha' gnyis la zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnam @201b par rtog pa dang /
translated: The discrimination of the aggregates, the discrimination of attachment to name-and-form, the discrimination of attachment to the two extremes, the discrimination of not knowing defilement and purification,

original: 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: the discrimination of not abiding in the noble path, the discrimination of the objective, the discrimination of self, etc., and the discrimination of the arising, etc. of purification.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu'o //
translated: These are the nine discriminations of the basis of defilement.

original: de bzhin du phung po'i don du rnam par rtog pa dang / skye mched du rnam par rtog pa dang / khams su rnam par rtog pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar rnam par rtog pa dang / stong pa'i don la rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po'i don du rnam par rtog pa dang / skye mched du rnam par rtog pa dang / khams su rnam par rtog pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar rnam par rtog pa dang / stong pa'i don la rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: Likewise, there are the concepts of the aggregates, the concepts of the sense spheres, the concepts of the elements, the concepts of dependent origination, the concepts of the meaning of emptiness,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog pa dang ; mthong ba'i lam la rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la rnam par rtog pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam la rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog pa dang ; mthong ba'i lam la rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la rnam par rtog pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam la rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: the concepts of the perfections, the concepts of the path of seeing, the concepts of the path of cultivation, and the concepts of the path of no learning.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa dgu'o //üîΩbdag sogs rang dbang ngo bo dang / de bzhin phung sogs rten sgo nas //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa dgu'o // bdag sogs rang dbang ngo bo dang / de bzhin phung sogs rten sgo nas //
translated: The concepts that are based on the entities of the side of the antidote are also of nine types.

original: rdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyis //
analyzed: rdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyis //
translated: The concepts of the self and so forth, of independence, of essence, and likewise, of the aggregates and so forth, as supports,

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //üîΩces pa la //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gnyis su 'dod // ces pa la //
translated: are asserted to be the two types of graspingüîΩin terms of substantial and imputed supports.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The concepts of grasping are also of two types.

original: rdzas kyi bdag nyid du gnas pa dang / btags pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi bdag nyid du gnas pa dang / btags pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: It is established as a substantial nature and it is established as an imputed nature.

original: rdzas kyi bdag nyid kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba rang dbang la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnam pa dgu nyid kyis de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang so sor rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi bdag nyid kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba rang dbang la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnam pa dgu nyid kyis de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang so sor rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The substantial nature is the nine types of discrimination that have the nature of independence, etc., as will be explained. The object of those is the nine types of discrimination.

original: btags pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa yang phung po la sogs pa la brten pa'i sgo nas rnam pa dgu nyid kyi de'i yul can nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa yong rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: btags pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa yang phung po la sogs pa la brten pa'i sgo nas rnam pa dgu nyid kyi de'i yul can nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa yong rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The imputed nature is also established as nine types by way of the aggregates, etc., and the object of those is the nine types of discrimination.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: de bzhin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa ste /
translated: Likewise,

original: ji ltar gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor rnam pa dgu yin pa de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog kyang zhes ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor rnam pa dgu yin pa de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog kyang zhes ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that just as the discriminations of the apprehended are nine types, so too the discriminations of the apprehender are nine types.

original: de bdag rang dbang can du rnam par rtog pa dang / gcig pur rnam par rtog pa dang / rgyur rnam bar rtog pa dang / lta ba po la sogs pa'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs par rnam par rtog pa dang /üîΩbdag 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gzhir rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag mthong ba'i lam gyi gzhir rnam pa rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzhir rnam par rtog pa dang / don @202a * //
analyzed: de bdag rang dbang can du rnam par rtog pa dang / gcig pur rnam par rtog pa dang / rgyur rnam bar rtog pa dang / lta ba po la sogs pa'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs par rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gzhir rnam par rtog pa dang / bdag mthong ba'i lam gyi gzhir rnam pa rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi gzhir rnam par rtog pa dang / don @202a * //
translated: the conception of self as independent, the conception of self as unitary, the conception of self as a cause, the conception of self as a viewer, etc., the conception of self as afflicted,

original: byas pa'i gzhir rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: byas pa'i gzhir rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: the conception of self as the basis of freedom from attachment, the conception of self as the basis of the path of seeing, the conception of self as the basis of the path of meditation, and the conception of self as the basis of the accomplishment of the goal.

original: rdzas kyi rang bzhin la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang bzhin la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: These are the nine conceptions that are based on the nature of substance.

original: phung por btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / skye mched du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / khams su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par byang bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: phung por btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / skye mched du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / khams su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par byang bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: The conceptualization of the aggregates, the conceptualization of the sense spheres, the conceptualization of the elements, the conceptualization of dependent origination, the conceptualization of purification,

original: mthong ba'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / khyad par gyi lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / khyad par gyi lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes pa ste /
translated: the conceptualization of the path of seeing, the conceptualization of the path of cultivation, the conceptualization of the path of distinction, and the conceptualization of the path of no learning.

original: btags pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa du'o //
analyzed: btags pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa du'o //
translated: These are the ten types of conceptualization that exist as the nature of designations.

original: sngon du mdor bstan pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa de rgyas par bstan pa'i dus la babs pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngon du mdor bstan pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa de rgyas par bstan pa'i dus la babs pas gsungs pa /
translated: Since the time has come to explain in detail the grasping that was briefly taught earlier, it is said:

original: sems mi 'gong ba nyid sogs kyis //
analyzed: sems mi 'gong ba nyid sogs kyis //
translated: By not being discouraged and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed /üîΩde yi mi mthun phyogs por ba //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed / de yi mi mthun phyogs por ba //
translated: ,üîΩis the one who always completely holds

original: rnam pa kun du yongs 'dzin yin //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa kun du yongs 'dzin yin // zhes pa la /
translated: the antidote to the resistances.

original: sems zhes pa ni slob ma'i sems so //
analyzed: sems zhes pa ni slob ma'i sems so //
translated: The mind is the student's mind.

original: mi 'gong ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bskyed pa la ma zhum pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gong ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bskyed pa la ma zhum pa'o //
translated: Not discouraged means not fainthearted about producing the collections of merit and knowledge.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ji ltar dman par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ji ltar dman par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase etc. means not to be contemptuous.

original: de bzhin tu yang dag pa thabs la mkhas pas rang bzhin med pa la mkhas pas rang bzhin med pa la sos pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin tu yang dag pa thabs la mkhas pas rang bzhin med pa la mkhas pas rang bzhin med pa la sos pa ston pa'o //
translated: Likewise, by the skill in means of reality, by the skill in realitylessness, he teaches realitylessness.

original: rang bzhin med pa ni btags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa ni btags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa yin gyi /
translated: Realitylessness is the emptiness of the imputed duality of subject and object.

original: thams cad du chad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du chad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a total nihilism.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bsod nams kyi stong nge gnyis ka yang ston pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bsod nams kyi stong nge gnyis ka yang ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase etc. indicates both the collections of merit and knowledge.

original: de'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩgsungs pa / de yi mi mthun phyogs por ba //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na / gsungs pa / de yi mi mthun phyogs por ba //
translated: What is the difference between them?

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: It is said:üîΩThe antidote to the resistances.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi de dag gi gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna la sogs pa dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi de dag gi gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna la sogs pa dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The resistances to those merits and intuitions are stinginess, etc. and nescience, etc.

original: de dag bor ba ni gang zhig de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag bor nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de dag ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bor ba ni gang zhig de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag bor nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de dag ston pa'o //
translated: Their abandonment is the teaching of those merits and intuitions after abandoning those resistances.

original: de dag nye bar bskyed pa po ser sna la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i skyes bu'i khyad par yang dag par yongs su 'dzin pa pa'i @202b bshes gnyen zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dag nye bar bskyed pa po ser sna la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i skyes bu'i khyad par yang dag par yongs su 'dzin pa pa'i @202b bshes gnyen zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The special person who is free from the faults of stinginess, etc. and who is the producer of those merits and intuitions is the spiritual teacher, who is to be fully accepted.

original: da ni sgrub pa'i rten brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sgrub pa'i rten brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the basis of the practice is to be stated.

original: sgrub pa ni rten byang chub kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rten byang chub kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice is the practice of the bodhisattva.

original: rten ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: rten ni gzhi'o //
translated: The basis is the foundation.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dan /
analyzed: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dan /
translated: The six realizations, the antidotes, and the relinquishments,

original: de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang / shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
analyzed: de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang / shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
translated: The order of the perfections is established by their order of cause and effect, and also by the order of their predominance.üîΩThe order of the perfections is established by their order of cause and effect, and also by the order of their predominance.

original: 'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes brjod //üîΩces pa la //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes brjod // ces pa la //
translated: The perfection of giving is the cause for obtaining a life with abundant material goods, and such a life is the cause for being able to practice the other perfections.üîΩThe perfection of morality is the cause for obtaining a good life, and a good life is the cause for not being harmed.üîΩThe perfection of patience is the cause for not being harmed, and not being harmed is the cause for being able to undertake the practice.üîΩThe perfection of effort is the cause for the practice, and the practice is the cause for the mind becoming concentrated.üîΩThe perfection of concentration is the cause for the mind becoming concentrated, and the mind concentrated is the cause for the direct intuition of reality.

original: drod la sogs pa bcu gsum gyi rtogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgrub pa'i rten ni rigs te thog mar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpar brjod do //üîΩchos kyi dbyings por ma grub ba nyid dngos su rigs ma yin te /
analyzed: drod la sogs pa bcu gsum gyi rtogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgrub pa'i rten ni rigs te thog mar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpar brjod do // chos kyi dbyings por ma grub ba nyid dngos su rigs ma yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the cause for the direct intuition of reality, and the direct intuition of reality is the cause for the attainment of the result.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa yin pa nyid kyis rigs zhes brjod do //üîΩrgyu'i don gyis rigs kyi don te /üîΩji skad gsungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyid do ;
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa yin pa nyid kyis rigs zhes brjod do //üîΩrgyu'i don gyis rigs kyi don te /üîΩji skad gsungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyid do ;
translated: The order of the perfections is also established by the order of their predominance.üîΩThe perfection of giving is predominant in the first bhumi, the perfection of morality in the second, the perfection of patience in the third, the perfection of effort in the fourth, the perfection of concentration in the fifth, and the perfection of wisdom is predominant in the sixth.

original: rtogs pa'i chos drug ces pa ni drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos drug ces pa ni drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam zhes pa ste /
translated: The Dharma of realization is sixfold: heat, peak, forbearance, the supreme mundane state, the path of seeing, and the path of cultivation.

original: chos rnam pa drug rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnam pa drug rtogs pa'o //
translated: Realization of the six aspects of Dharma.üîΩThe antidote and the abandonment,

original: gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang / zhes pa la gnyen po'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag ni gnyen po'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //üîΩyongs su gtugs ni rtogs pa brtan pa'am /
analyzed: gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang / zhes pa la gnyen po'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag ni gnyen po'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs so // yongs su gtugs ni rtogs pa brtan pa'am /
translated: The antidote and the side that is adverse to it are the antidote and the side that is adverse to it.üîΩThe thorough investigation is the firm realization,

original: rnam par rtog pa zad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zad pa ste /
translated: or the exhaustion of conceptualization.

original: de dag gcig tu bgrang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bgrang ngo //
translated: Those two are counted as one.üîΩWisdom and compassion,

original: shes rab snying brtser bcas pa zhes pa la snying rjes yongs su zin pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: shes rab snying brtser bcas pa zhes pa la snying rjes yongs su zin pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom that is fully possessed by compassion.

original: de dag kyang gcig tu gsal lo //
analyzed: de dag kyang gcig tu gsal lo //
translated: Those two are also counted as one.üîΩThe disciples are not shared in common,

original: slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos so //
analyzed: slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma is not shared in common with the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // zhes pa la /

translated: Wisdom is the discernment at the time of dedicating this giving to perfect enlightenment, thinking, ‚ÄúAll of this is like an illusion.‚Äù
