original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ma skyes pas so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ma skyes pas so //
translated: because all phenomena such as the aggregate of form are unborn.

original: chos rnams dmigs pa med pa ni //
analyzed: chos rnams dmigs pa med pa ni //
translated: The non-apprehension of phenomena means

original: zhes pa la mi dmigs par rnam par dag par byas te /
analyzed: zhes pa la mi dmigs par rnam par dag par byas te /
translated: Having purified it by not objectifying it,

original: kun rdzob tu rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rnams bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnal 'byor pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rnams bskyed par bya'o //
translated: the yogi/nƒ´ should generate all the qualities of the Buddhas in the conventional.

original: don chen zhes pa la chen po ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi don te /
analyzed: don chen zhes pa la chen po ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi don te /
translated: As for ‚Äúgreat meaning,‚Äù ‚Äúgreat‚Äù means the meaning of Buddhahood.

original: 'dis na don chen ni bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'dis na don chen ni bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: The ‚Äúgreat meaning‚Äù is the path of cultivation,

original: de'i sgom pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de'i sgom pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: and its cultivation is the path of cultivation characterized by manifestation.

original: bsgom @217b pa'i lam la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag khas len pa'i rtsa ba ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom @217b pa'i lam la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag khas len pa'i rtsa ba ni mos pa'o //
translated: Faith is the root of accepting all the qualities of the Buddha, such as the path of cultivation, and so forth.üîΩThat faith is said to be the very cause of that.

original: mos pa de nyid gang gi rgyu mtshan nyid kyis zhes pa la gsungs pa //
analyzed: mos pa de nyid gang gi rgyu mtshan nyid kyis zhes pa la gsungs pa //
translated: It is said:

original: sangs rgyas bsten dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsten dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa //
translated: Relying on the Buddha, generosity, and so forth, and skill in means,

original: 'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
analyzed: 'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
translated: are the causes of faith in this.

original: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni //
analyzed: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni //
translated: The causes of being bereft of the DharmaüîΩare

original: bdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos la ma mos dang // phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos la ma mos dang // phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa'o //
translated: Being overcome by the darkness of Mara,üîΩLacking interest in the profound Dharma,üîΩStrongly clinging to the aggregates and so forth,üîΩAnd being seized by evil companions.üîΩ

original: zhes pa ste /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsten cing bkur ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la goms par bya ba dang / thabs ni sangs rgyas nyid 'grub pa'i rgyu rkyen te /
analyzed: zhes pa ste / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsten cing bkur ba dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la goms par bya ba dang / thabs ni sangs rgyas nyid 'grub pa'i rgyu rkyen te /
translated: Being overwhelmed by the darkness of Mara, lack of interest in the profound Dharma, strong attachment to the aggregates, etc., and being seized by evil companions.

original: de la mkhas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin no //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin no //
translated: The cause of interest in the Buddha qualities is the service and worship of all the Tathagatas, the practice of the ten perfections such as the giving, and the means which is the cause and condition for the achievement of Buddhahood.

original: bdud kyi thibs kyis non cing 'tshe ba dang / zab mo'i chos la mi mos pa dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched la mngon par zhen pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa zhes pa ni chos kyi phongs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyi thibs kyis non cing 'tshe ba dang / zab mo'i chos la mi mos pa dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched la mngon par zhen pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa zhes pa ni chos kyi phongs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of poverty in the Dharma is being overwhelmed and harmed by the darkness of Mara, lack of interest in the profound Dharma, strong attachment to the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields, and being seized by evil companions.

original: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam gsungs pa /
translated: The path of cultivation is taught to have the characteristic of purification:

original: 'bras bu dag pa gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag pa gzugs la sogs //
translated: The result is the purification of form, etc.

original: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
analyzed: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
translated: Because of that very purity.

original: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing //üîΩbcad du med pas dag par brjod //
analyzed: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing // bcad du med pas dag par brjod //
translated: Because those two are not different

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: and are not divisible, they are said to be pure.

original: 'bras bu ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni byang chub ste /
translated: The result is enlightenment.

original: zag pa med pa rnam par dag pa gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs la nges par grol ba de ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnam par dag pa gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs la nges par grol ba de ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: That which is undefiled and pure and is definitely liberated from its opposing factors is not something other than that.

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa dag pa nyid do //
translated: Rather, it is the purity of form and so forth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po zag pa dang bcas pa gang zhig dag pa ni de nyid de'i phyir 'bras bu dag pa dang gzugs dag pa la sogs pa dag pa de gnyis dbyer med gcad du med pa'i phyir tha dad ma yin zhes pa ni 'bras bu
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po zag pa dang bcas pa gang zhig dag pa ni de nyid de'i phyir 'bras bu dag pa dang gzugs dag pa la sogs pa dag pa de gnyis dbyer med gcad du med pa'i phyir tha dad ma yin zhes pa ni 'bras bu
translated: That which is the purity of the contaminated aggregates of form and so forth is that very result. Therefore, because the purity of the result and the purity of form and so forth are not different and are not divisible, they are said to be not different.

original: dang / gzugs la sogs pa gnyis ka rnam par dag pas na tha dad du ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: dang / gzugs la sogs pa gnyis ka rnam par dag pas na tha dad du ma grub pa'o //
translated: The result and form and so forth are both pure, and therefore they are not established as different.

original: gcad du med ces pa ni 'bras bu dag pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dag pa gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcad du med ces pa ni 'bras bu dag pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dag pa gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin ba'i don to //
translated: Not divisible means that the purity of the result and the purity of form and so forth are of the nature of nonduality.

original: thun mong gi rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas bye brag rnams gsungs pa /üîΩnyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
analyzed: thun mong gi rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas bye brag rnams gsungs pa / nyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
translated: Having taught the general characteristics of purity, he teaches the particular ones.

original: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa @218a * //
analyzed: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa @218a * //
translated: The purity of the disciples, the rhinoceroses, and the bodhisattvas is due to the elimination of the three obscurations of the afflictions, the knowable, and the path.

original: ste ; / sangs rgyas rnam kun shin tu ba //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: ste ; / sangs rgyas rnam kun shin tu ba // zhes pa ste /
translated: The purity of the buddhas is in every way complete.

original: 'dod chags pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa las nyan thos kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa las nyan thos kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the disciples is due to the elimination of the afflictions of desire.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa las rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa las rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the rhinoceroses is due to the elimination of the one part of the obscurations of the knowable, which is the apprehension of signs.

original: theg pa gsum thob par byed pa la sgrib pa spangs pa las byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum thob par byed pa la sgrib pa spangs pa las byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the bodhisattvas is due to the elimination of the obscurations that prevent the attainment of the three vehicles.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa las shin tu ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam par dag pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa las shin tu ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam par dag pa'o ;
translated: The purification of the Buddha Bhagavans is due to the elimination of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, together with their propensities, with regard to all phenomena of every aspect.

original: / sa dgu ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa brgyad de /
analyzed: / sa dgu ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa brgyad de /
translated: The nine levels are the desire realm, the eight concentrations and formless absorptions.

original: de rnams rnam par dag pa ni bsgrub par bya'o //üîΩde bas na sa dgu la bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgur bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams rnam par dag pa ni bsgrub par bya'o // de bas na sa dgu la bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgur bstan par bya ste /
translated: Their purification is to be accomplished.

original: sa dgu la ni chen po yi //üîΩchen po la sogs dri ma yi //üîΩgnyen po'i sgo nas chung ngu yi //
analyzed: sa dgu la ni chen po yi // chen po la sogs dri ma yi // gnyen po'i sgo nas chung ngu yi //
translated: Therefore, the path of cultivation should be taught as having nine aspects on the nine levels.üîΩThe path of the small and so on

original: chung ngu la sogs lam yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu la sogs lam yin no //
translated: is the antidote to the great and so onüîΩof the defilements of the nine levels.

original: zhes pa ste dag par byed pas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste dag par byed pas na dag pa'o //

translated: The four purities: purity of physical basis, purity of object, purity of thought, and purity of knowledge.üîΩThe four fearlessnesses: fearlessness in regard to the teachings on cutting off, fearlessness in regard to the teachings on definite release, fearlessness in regard to the teachings on the obscurations, and fearlessness in regard to the teachings on the path.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'o //üîΩ'khrul ba mi mnga' ba dang / ca co mi mnga' ba dang / dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang / 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga' ba dang / sems can rnams la btang snyoms su gzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'o //üîΩ'khrul ba mi mnga' ba dang / ca co mi mnga' ba dang / dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang / 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga' ba dang / sems can rnams la btang snyoms su gzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang /
translated: The four perfect knowledges: perfect knowledge of phenomena, perfect knowledge of meanings, perfect knowledge of clear expression, and perfect knowledge of confidence-giving eloquence.üîΩThe four analytical knowledges: analytical knowledge of the teachings, analytical knowledge of meanings, analytical knowledge of clear expression, and analytical knowledge of confidence-giving eloquence.üîΩThe four unhinderednesses: unhindered knowledge of phenomena, unhindered knowledge of meanings, unhindered knowledge of clear expression, and unhindered knowledge of confidence-giving eloquence.

original: 'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / shes rab nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang /
analyzed: 'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / shes rab nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang /
translated: He is without loss of aspiration, without loss of effort, without loss of mindfulness, without loss of concentration, without loss of wisdom, and without loss of liberation.

original: lus kyi las rnams ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang / ngag gi las rnams ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang / yid kyi las rnams ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang / 'das pa la ma chags shing ma mnyams pa'i ye shes dang /

translated: His physical actions are preceded by wisdom, his verbal actions are preceded by wisdom, and his mental actions are preceded by wisdom. He has the wisdom that is unattached and unimpeded regarding the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams la ma chags shing ma nyams pa'i ye shes dang / da ltar ba rnams la ma chags shing ma nyams pa'i ye shes te sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do //

translated: He has the wisdom that is unattached and unimpeded regarding the future. He has the wisdom that is unattached and unimpeded regarding the present. These are the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi gtsor rang byung ba dang / rnam pa kun mngon par byang chub pa zhes pa ste /üîΩyang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la rnam pa dag sum cu rtsa dgu'o //
